intro: Ozomelis varians, commonly known as the variable ozomelis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ozomelis varians produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months.
